title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.16-17 | 06-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम ज्ञानति मिरान्दस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षरुन्मीलितं येनतस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पाधाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेलांत स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधरा श्रीवासाधी गौरभक्त वृन्दा
हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्ण कृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा राम रामा हरे हरे
ओम्नमो भगवते वासुदेवाया नारायणम नमस्कृत्या नरम्चैवनरोत्तमं देवीम सरस्वतीम व्यासं ततो जयमुती रयेत
In this session we will be discussing from the 16th verse of the 8th chapter of 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
मा मम्स्था हेतद आश्चरियम् सर्वाश्चर्यमये अच्छुते यईदं मायया देव्या सुझति अवति हंति अजःहा
The meaning of this verse is, O Brahmanas, this is Suta Goswami addressing the sages of Naimisharanya.
O Brahmanas!
Do not think this to be especially wonderful in the activities of the mysterious and infallible personality of the Goddess.
अश्चरियम्या तती लोड्ड वो स अल मिस्तेरियस् और अच्छुत अच्छुत
The Lord is described in so many ways according to His different characteristics.
अच्छुत वो जहूंगीेमान के सिर आज बसे किएक्नेरा।
So qualities which are very unique to the Supreme Lord only. Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.

Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.
Here, Ashtariya, Maya and Achyuta, two different qualities of the Supreme Lord are described.

Because we think that he is a person like us or he is a person little more powerful than us. No, he is supremely powerful, he is unlimitedly powerful, he can never be compared with anybody else, he is incomparable and he is absolute.

He always is in that position of having the supreme power, always, eternally it's a fact. So, therefore, this point, nothing is impossible for the Supreme Lord, but all his actions are wonderful for us and thus he is always beyond the range of our conceivable limits.

This will be explained in a future verse, which is a prayer offer, a series of prayers offered by Queen Kunti. That's the main subject of this chapter, prayers by Queen Kunti, but we're going to start discussing that from the next session, the prayers of Queen Kunti and the series of prayers, wonderful prayers.
So, these prayers expressed by self-realized pure devotees.
Clearly helps us understand what is the nature of the Supreme Lord.
So, one of the things mentioned here is, the Supreme Lord's actions are always beyond the range of our conceivable limits.
The Lord is the all-powerful, all-perfect personality of Godhead, all-powerful, all-perfect.
There's no trace of any defect or any inebriety.
The Lord is the Supreme Lord.
The Lord is 10% perfect.
Here, the Lord is referring to Krishna.
Krishna is 10% perfect.
Whereas others, namely Narayana, Brahma, Shiva, the demigods and all other living beings, possess only different percentages of such perfection.
This is analyzed by the Goswamis of Vrindavan, the disciples of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
That only Krishna is 10% perfect.
Others are all expansions of Krishna, or expansions of the expansions of Krishna, or very, very, very tiny parts of Krishna.
And they possess always a percentage of the qualities of Krishna in perfection.
No one is equal.
No one is equal to or greater than Krishna.
He is unrivaled.
This is a fact.
The 17th verse.
The translation of the 17th verse.
Thus said from the radiation.
This is the translation of the Brahmastra.
Kunti, the chaste devotee of the Lord.
Pratha, Sati.
Pratha means Kunti.
Sati means the chaste devotee of the Lord.
And her five sons and Draupadi.
Atma jaihi, sah, Krishna ya.
Krishna ya refers to Draupadi.
Draupadi is also called Krishna.
So, along with Kunti, along with her five sons and Draupadi,
addressed Lord Krishna.
As he started for home,
Krishna finished his work of installing Yudhishthira Maharaj
after the battle of Kurukshetra as the emperor of the world.
Now he was going back to Dwaraka.
So, while he was about to start for Dwaraka,
Kunti approached Krishna and addressed him.
And there will be a series of prayers Kunti will offer to Krishna.
In the purport, it is explained by Srila Prabhupada,
Kunti is described here in a sati or chaste
due to her unalloyed devotion to Lord Sri Krishna.
This term is used by Prabhupada many times
in the Bhagavad Gita and the Bhagavad Gita.
Unalloyed devotion.
Unalloyed means it is sent person pure.
There is no admixture of karma or jnana in such bhakti.
Pure devotional service is described by Srila Prabhupada Swami as
anyabila ashita shunyam jnana karmadi anavratam.
jnana karmadi anavratam.
It is unmixed with any jnana or karma.
Because karma and jnana without bhakti is never successful.
Any pious activity anybody may do,
if it is not mixed with a little bhakti,
it will always be incomplete, unsuccessful, imperfect.
Same thing with transcendental knowledge.
Unless that is mixed with a little bhakti,
it is always imperfect, incomplete.
So, both karma and jnana are dependent on bhakti
for a person to achieve perfection.
But bhakti, which is pure bhakti,
is independent of karma and jnana.
Bhakti is never dependent on karma or jnana.
Pure devotion is completely independent of everything else.
So, therefore,
kunti is described as the most,
the chaste lady, sati.
And it is because she is the pure devotee of Krishna.
Not only kunti, the five pandavas,
Draupadi, Parikshit,
all of them, Arjuna, everyone,
they are all pure devotees of Krishna.
100% pure devotees.
It is further said by Srila Prabhupada,
her mind will now be expressed in the following prayers for Lord Krishna.
Beginning from the 18th verse,
prayers of Queen Kunti will be presented.
A chaste devotee of the Lord
does not look to others,
namely any other living being or demigod,
even for deliverance from danger.
Typically, in the material world,
we have got different sources for prayer,
depending on the type of protection,
depending on the type of danger,
or depending on the type of problem we may face,
or depending on the type of facilities we may have.
We have so many sources of protection.
We may have so many different dangers.
The material world is always filled with dangers.
Padam padam yat vipadam.
But,
for a pure devotee of Krishna,
Krishna is the only protector.
And,
Krishna is the only protector means
such a devotee
never depends on another living being
or another demigod.
Never.
Never, never, never, never.
So, this is very, very, very significant.
Nobody else in the material world,
other than a pure devotee,
depends exclusively on Krishna.
So, this is what we should learn
from the Bhagavatam
and from the lives of great devotees.
And, from Krishna's own instructions,
we should learn this,
that we have no guarantee
of sent person protection
except when we learn
to completely depend on Krishna.
So, if at all you want full protection,
under all circumstances,
you should learn
to depend on Krishna exclusively.
Now,
now,
Krishna is there and also so many other people
are there to protect me.
No.
So, Srila Prabhupada says here,
that was all along the characteristic
of the whole family of the Pandavas.
It's not just true of Kunti.
It's true of all the family members
of the Pandavas.
Pandava family.
They knew nothing except Krishna
and therefore the Lord was also
always ready to help them in all respects,
in all circumstances.
See, Krishna is
always reciprocally
giving protection
or offering some help.
If I depend completely on Krishna,
then Krishna will protect me
and help me always
under all circumstances.
But, if I am not so much
completely dependent on Krishna,
then,
then Krishna will say,
depending on who you want
to take protection from,
take protection from that source.
And that is not guaranteed
to protect us in all circumstances,
other sources.
So, therefore,
one should not look for imperfect help
from imperfect living beings or from demigods,
but one should look for all help from Krishna alone,
who is competent always to save his devotees.
So, that is the conclusion.
I will stop here.
Grantharaaj Srimad Bhagavatam Ki Jai.
